title: Great App...
comment: Help fight the good fight!! Install and help Mozilla open source geolocation services.

title: Helps Mozilla & it's fun!
comment: This little app helps Mozilla improve their location services but using it can also be quite enjoyable in itself. The public leaderboard allows for some friendly competition with your friends while doing something worthwhile for a good cause :-)

title: Moved to OpenWlanMap
comment: Feels closer to their users, is more fun, you get more information out.

title: It is no good if it do not allow you to enter the location manually.
comment: Idea: if the location report by Google is incorrect, then Mozilla simply upload the incorrect location to it's database.  So, all the purpose is to duplicate the data of Google Map, by asking user to travel every spot and capture the data of Google Location Service and feed into Mozilla ?

The app doesn't use Google Location Service, it performs GPS-only collection, so I don't understand your comment. Some GPS locations may be a few hundred meters off, but over repeated scans, these errors get corrected.

title: Still stuck
comment: It still gets stuck after pausing, have to FC and restart, sometimes two or three times. VZW HTC One M8. Otherwise great.
Sorry, we are having a brute of time with all the different devices and their sensor implementations. Can you try 1.6.0? Thanks for the feedback.
Reports are uploaded automatically when we create a wifi hotspot for file sharing. So that the reports are not reaching to MLS.

Until reports are successfully received by the server, the app will keep trying periodically to upload. There is a new 'file a bug' feature in the settings screen of 1.6.0, so if you are still seeing a bug with this, please file it, thanks.

title: Well-done but…
comment: Overall, it does what it's supposed to with mostly obvious settings and controls. However, it needs support for moving the app to an SD card — or at least moving the map tile cache there — to support lower-end devices.
We should be able to fix this for the next release. This is the bug for that https://github.com/mozilla/MozStumbler/issues/1183

title: Helping and accelerating to bring Malaysia to open space faster but...
comment: On Android 4.0, the app seems to not able to collect any data because of the so-said "Battery Saving" mode in which the GPS got locked and then disabled again and then relocate. This way the app cannot collect data unless I force on the GPS lock by using another map/GPS app and put Stumbler in background. Please fix!

1.5.4 has some fixes to this. However, we may still be having problems with the sensors on specific devices, can you email more info to mozstumbler@mozilla.com or file an issue to https://github.com/mozilla/MozStumbler/issues
Help Mozilla to cover the world!

title: Great app but kills your battery
comment: This is an awesome system for a good cause but it would be better if there were ways of reducing the power consumption. EDIT: Power use is great now!
The new 1.5.2 release we just pushed should be much better with saving your battery usage when idle. Let us know!
Awesome app

title: Since update, not working
comment: I have been a faithful  stumbler since the apps inception. However, since the update,  the rescan has not started since sensing no movement. On order for it to work, I have to restart the app. I am using a Samsung s5 on Verizon's network.

Added a bug for this: https://github.com/mozilla/MozStumbler/issues/1322
Chris, if you can add more info on that bug it would help, thanks.
Thank you Mozilla for creating an open location platform for future :)

title: We need this
comment: If you care about Open Source apps being location aware, we need this. Please download and support.

title: Good project
comment: Use this app whereever you can to collect free location data. Preferably have a backup battery with you to compensate for higher powers usage. It would be nice to see all visible Cell IDs!
The new 1.5.2 release we just pushed should be much better with saving your battery usage when idle.  Let us know!

title: Unfortunately, a battery hog
comment: This is a good idea but on my Nexus 4, it drains the battery way too much for it to be practical. Maybe adding some options to reduce frequency of scans would help.
The new 1.5.2 release we just pushed should be much better with saving your battery usage when idle.  Let us know!

title: Non-free project
comment: The Wi-Fi database generated is neither under a free license, nor can it even be downloaded by the community for offline routing. Better contribute to OpenWLANMap.
We don't let you download Wifi data yet because of privacy concerns. You can find a more detailed explanation here, as well as a set of cellular data: https://location.services.mozilla.com/downloads

title: Devours battery

The new 1.5.2 release we just pushed should be much better with saving your battery usage when idle. Let us know!

title: Easy to setup
comment: No setup needed to help a great effort. Try and get in the leaderboard if you are feeling competitive (setup nick in settings)

title: Great initiative
comment: Thank you, Mozilla, for fighting for open data.

title: At last, truly open location data.
comment: A few rough edges but works well and is fun to collect dsta and work up the league table

title: Poor
comment: Do you remember when Mozilla was about preserving your privacy, as opposed to making it easy to leak your privacy to a US company? Me neither these days.  It's perfectly possible to do geolocation of the places I go, for me, without reporting everything to some company.  It doesn't help others as much, but it's a lot better at preserving privacy, and new devices can fall back to GPS.

We don't have a lot of choice, either pay closed companies for this data, or try and make this data open. Network geolocation services are ubiquitous and required for location applications. In terms of openness: the collection code and server code are open-source, the collected data is being opened to the public.
Great app
Open location FTW!

title: Great idea
comment: Running well on my S5. Looking forward to exploring new wireless realms
